title: Beacon Node Stuck in initial-sync When Trying to Run a Local, Merged-From-Genesis testnet
body:
# üêû Bug Report

### Description
When starting a beacon node with a custom genesis state, it never gets past initial-sync

### Has this worked before in a previous version?
Unknown

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
- Configuration files
[execution-genesis.json](https://github.com/oone-world/merge-from-genesis-testnet/blob/main/execution-genesis.json), [beacon-config.yaml](https://github.com/oone-world/merge-from-genesis-testnet/blob/main/beacon-config.yaml), [beacon-mnemonics.yaml](https://github.com/oone-world/merge-from-genesis-testnet/blob/main/beacon-mnemonics.yaml), [execution-sk.json](https://github.com/oone-world/merge-from-genesis-testnet/blob/main/execution-sk.json), [execution-pw.txt](https://github.com/oone-world/merge-from-genesis-testnet/blob/main/execution-pw.txt)

1. Generate a custom genesis state using the eth2-testnet-genesis tool
```.\eth2-testnet-genesis.exe merge ^
--config "beacon-config.yaml" ^
--eth1-config "execution-genesis.json" ^
--mnemonics "beacon-mnemonics.yaml" ^
--state-output "beacon-genesis.ssz"
```

2. Initialize two geth nodes (and import one account into the first one)
```
geth --datadir _execution init execution-genesis.json
geth --datadir _execution2 init execution-genesis.json
geth --datadir _execution account import execution-sk.json
``` 

3. Start the first geth node
```
geth ^
--networkid=39677693 ^
--http ^
--http.api=eth,net,web3,personal,miner,engine,admin ^
--http.addr=127.0.0.1 ^
--authrpc.vhosts=* ^
--authrpc.jwtsecret rpc-jwt.hex ^
--datadir _execution ^
--allow-insecure-unlock ^
--unlock 0x123463a4b065722e99115d6c222f267d9cabb524 ^
--password execution-pw.txt ^
--syncmode full ^
console
```
4. Start the second geth node (using the first node as bootnode)
```
--networkid 39677693 ^
--datadir _execution2 ^
--authrpc.port 8651 ^
--authrpc.jwtsecret rpc-jwt.hex ^
--port 31303 ^
--ipcdisable ^
--bootnodes "enode://ff10b3b0f71a6a8b087301c1b5594ef8b91b01fb43c196e3d99a9c79e9abc18457851383b2dd39cf669e01c6745c7392d211aad65b9a5f5325dccf3baee8ba2a@127.0.0.1:30303"
```

5. Start the first beacon node
```
.\prysm\prysm.bat beacon-chain ^
--execution-endpoint=http://127.0.0.1:8551 ^
--jwt-secret=rpc-jwt.hex ^
--datadir=_beacon ^
--chain-id=39677693 ^
--chain-config-file=beacon-config.yaml ^
--contract-deployment-block 0 ^
--deposit-contract 0x0420420420420420420420420420420420420420 ^
--genesis-state=beacon-genesis.ssz ^
--min-sync-peers=0 ^
--suggested-fee-recipient=0x123463a4b065722e99115d6c222f267d9cabb524 ^
--verbosity debug ^
--accept-terms-of-use
```

6. Start the second beacon node (using the first node as peer)
```
.\prysm\prysm.bat beacon-chain ^
--execution-endpoint=http://127.0.0.1:8651 ^
--jwt-secret=rpc-jwt.hex ^
--datadir=_beacon2 ^
--chain-id=39677693 ^
--chain-config-file=beacon-config.yaml ^
--contract-deployment-block 0 ^
--deposit-contract 0x0420420420420420420420420420420420420420 ^
--genesis-state=beacon-genesis.ssz ^
--min-sync-peers=0 ^
--suggested-fee-recipient=0x123463a4b065722e99115d6c222f267d9cabb524 ^
--peer=/ip4/192.168.1.5/tcp/13000/p2p/16Uiu2HAkxC5zUwLyF6VzstZEDvdvfhpKhUcmV693HfYukA6YmZRr ^
--rpc-port=4001 ^
--p2p-tcp-port=13001 ^
--p2p-udp-port=12001 ^
--grpc-gateway-port=3501 ^
--monitoring-port=8001 ^
--verbosity trace ^
--accept-terms-of-use
```

7. Generate [validator keys](https://github.com/oone-world/merge-from-genesis-testnet/tree/main/validator-keys) using the deposit-cli tool

8. Import the keys into Prysm
```
.\prysm\prysm.bat validator accounts import ^
--keys-dir=validator-keys ^
--wallet-dir=_validator/wallet ^
--wallet-password-file=validator-password.txt ^
--mainnet
```

9. Start the validator
```
.\prysm\prysm.bat validator ^
--datadir=_validator ^
--wallet-dir=_validator/wallet ^
--wallet-password-file=validator-password.txt ^
--chain-config-file=beacon-config.yaml ^
--suggested-fee-recipient=0x123463a4b065722e99115d6c222f267d9cabb524 ^
--verbosity info ^
--accept-terms-of-use
```

## üî• Error
After the initial-sync start message, nothing happens.
When I ran the beacons with debug/trace verbosity, I found the below messages
<pre><code>
[2022-12-28 19:25:18] TRACE initial-sync: tick headSlot=0 highestExpectedSlot=32 staleEpoch=map[] state=map[0:{0:scheduled} 64:{2:new} 128:{4:skipped} 192:{6:skipped} 256:{8:skipped} 320:{10:skipped} 384:{12:skipped} 448:{14:skipped}]
